name: TheAtlantic
text: This year’s national reckoning over policing means that more Americans could stand to seriously listen to the music of Drakeo the Ruler and other young rappers who have been incarcerated, Hannah Giorgis writes. https://t.co/a4K4qnylrG

name: TheAtlantic
text: What does "herd immunity" mean? James Hamblin spoke with Howard Forman, a health-policy professor at Yale University who has followed the data on how “herd-immunity strategies” have gone in various countries. Listen on the latest "Social Distance" podcast: https://t.co/EigX4qfIMd https://t.co/j3iASUFw9x

name: TheAtlantic
text: Daily sewage sampling isn't an alternative for good, old-fashioned coronavirus swab tests, but they can give scientists an idea of community infection nearly immediately, writes @jane_c_hu: https://t.co/3Nzv60QL2N

name: TheAtlantic
text: How does time in the military shape a service member's perspective on American life? In 2017, we ran a series of essays by veterans, reflecting on how the experience affected their views on everything from health care to higher education: https://t.co/63JYNDSPrS

name: TheAtlantic
text: "If unrest isn’t becoming a vulnerability for Biden, that’s because he has been so much more astute in avoiding Trump’s trap than the young and online," @Yascha_Mounk writes: https://t.co/q1gc6OdPVJ

name: TheAtlantic
text: Three months after Kennedy Mitchum, a young Black activist, challenged Merriam-Webster on its imprecise definition of "racism," the dictionary has announced an amended entry. @bgzimmer reports: https://t.co/eJJjlCmyez

name: TheAtlantic
text: This summer may provide a grim preview of what the post-election period will be like, writes @PeterAtlantic: https://t.co/tmRSvN4NX2

name: TheAtlantic
text: Some colleges are trying to prevent COVID-19 outbreaks by surveilling their students. But trying to do so is all but useless, @zeynep writes: https://t.co/95e8puNmKs

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Of all the corners of American life susceptible to the cries to reopen during the pandemic, sports was always going to be among the first to cave," @JustinNXT writes: https://t.co/px9vdiyFkB

name: TheAtlantic
text: "As we try to manage our dispositions, we need two things. First, we need perspective; second, we need tranquility. And it’s voices from the past that can give us both," Alan Jacobs writes: https://t.co/cqy7rfPJxA

name: TheAtlantic
text: "No one is talking about the death of Paris the way some are talking about the death of New York. In its 2,000-year-long history, Paris has survived plenty of calamities," @mirakamdar writes: https://t.co/rhe1sxsUpj

name: TheAtlantic
text: Objections to the 1619 Project are less about “misstatements of historical fact,” than about the argument “that anti-black racism is a more intractable problem than most Americans are willing to admit,” @adamserwer wrote in 2019. https://t.co/SxeoluFipm

name: TheAtlantic
text: The misconception that stuttering is caused by anxiety or even poor parenting has long been debunked, writes @amberldance, but neuroscientists are now digging deeper into the condition's root cause. https://t.co/7XweJlgGsg

name: TheAtlantic
text: "The whole point of each incremental delay," @juliettekayyem writes, "was that the pandemic might change for the better—by Memorial Day, or July Fourth, or Labor Day, or Thanksgiving. The changes aren’t happening fast enough." https://t.co/wNgc1DMz1T

name: TheAtlantic
text: "On one side of the border, almost everybody took the virus seriously—and few people had it. On the other, the reverse." @DavidFrum returns from Canada: https://t.co/ex3zvm4A3k

name: TheAtlantic
text: “That's the beauty of the military—it forms these deep and lasting bonds, irrespective of your background.” Women’s friendships in this male-dominated world are even more special, two retired Army captains tell @julieebeck for “The Friendship Files”: https://t.co/4jGHyyjWtf

name: TheAtlantic
text: "In fifteen minutes there’s a bugle call, / The troops fall in and the roll is called. / Then out in front the troops all stand, / Saluting the flag with our hats in our hand." -- “My Industrial Work”: An anonymous poem from 1914. https://t.co/0vOw8GyuRy

name: TheAtlantic
text: Labor Day is a sunset of a holiday, a final chance to get outside and catch the summer’s warm glow. Here’s a miniature, non-exhaustive guide to staying safe as you go about your holiday plans. The latest Atlantic Daily by @mimbsy: https://t.co/XJI9hWssMv

name: TheAtlantic
text: “Mulan” is at its best when it indulges in flights of fancy. @davidlsims on the new Disney film’s preoccupation with gravitas: https://t.co/S6FzVC4dHG

name: TheAtlantic
text: Photos: Just over 4.6 million people live in the state of Louisiana, a state well known for its music, food, and festivals, many of which take place in its largest city, New Orleans—via @TheAtlPhoto: https://t.co/XL7294FzQp
